snippet: Lawyers for City Councilman Larry B. Seabrook had asked a judge to bar prosecutors from referring to their client as “Seabrook.”
abstract: Lawyers for New York City Councilman Larry B Seabrook are granted a request to Judge Deborah A Batts to bar prosecutors from referring to their client as 'Seabrook,' which they say is being used to demean their client in the eyes of the jury; retrial is underway following a mistrial after the jury deadlocked.
lead_paragraph: Lawyers for City Councilman Larry B. Seabrook had asked a judge to bar prosecutors from referring to their client as “Seabrook.”

headline.seo: Prosecutors in Seabrook Retrial Barred From Calling Him Just by Last Name
headline.main: Prosecutors in Seabrook Case Can’t Use Just His Last Name
headline.print_headline: Prosecutors in Seabrook Case Can’t Use Just His Last Name
